danish_publication: En gårdmand på Bornholm var frimurer, og derfor skulde Fanden have ham — for han skal jo have alle frimurerne. Når han gik til alters, nød han ikke af brødet eller af vinen. Da han var død og skulde jordes, og de kom til kirken med liget, sprang låget af kisten, og da var der ikke andet i den end en sort oksehud. Fanden havde jo taget ham.
english_publication: A farmer on Bornholm was a Freemason, and so the devil was supposed to get him--because he is supposed to get all Freemasons. When he went to communion, he didn't take bread or wine. When he was dead and was to be buried and they brought his corpse to the church, the lid of the casket burst open and there was nothing in there but a black ox hide. The devil had taken him.

etk_index.heading_danish: Om Fanden og forbund med ham
etk_index.heading_english: About the Devil and being in league with the Devil
